issue.title: *** New SubT Simulation docker image available on DockerHub ***

content.raw:
Ehm, well, the options were maybe swapped on the page \(there used to be the only “long one”\), and then the option with “./run.bash” was the 2nd … so what I mean that is working for me is the option

`./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` \(after xhost\+\)

so just to summarize the “long option” \(currently option 2\) does not work for me because of the old docker \(probably\):

`unknown flag: --gpus`  
`See 'docker run --help'.`
content.html:
Ehm, well, the options were maybe swapped on the page (there used to be the only “long one”), and then the option with “./run.bash” was the 2nd … so what I mean that is working for me is the option

./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 (after xhost+)

so just to summarize the “long option” (currently option 2) does not work for me because of the old docker (probably):

unknown flag: --gpus
See 'docker run --help'.
